<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ec28b133.1503">   <title>IPSA-NUS Methods School, Singapore, June 8-19, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ec28b133.1503</link>   <description> The 4th Annual IPSA-NUS Summer School for Social Science Research Methods will be held at the National University of Singapore, June 8-19, 2015.<br><br>This year's Methods School offers thirteen quantitative, qualitative, and formal methods courses, such as Bayesian Analysis, Case Study Analysis, Experimental Methods, Game Theory, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Mixed Methods, QCA, and Quantitative Text Analysis. All courses are taught by highly experienced international faculty from the U.S. and Europe and provide participants with rigorous, hands-on training in state-of-the-art research methods. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T22:05:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tobias Hofmann</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ec28b133.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;c4cad5d3.1503">   <title>Bullying - The Social Destruction of Self </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;c4cad5d3.1503</link>   <description> Dear SAI-IRISH-STUDIES Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Bullying]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/bullying&gt;Bullying&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/bullying&gt;<br><br>The Social Destruction of Self<br>Laura Martocci<br>&quot;A very useful and up-to-date discussion of the social-emotional origins of bullying.&quot;-Thomas Scheff, Professor Emeritus, University of California, Santa Barbara<br>"Martocci's book offers a new and exciting interdisciplinary and sociocultural approach to the serious and complex issue of bullying. Her approach focuses on the psychosocial dynamics of humiliation and shame-how to understand this relational process and how to change the behaviors that restore people's relations and identities. Bullying is complex and multifaceted work. I am greatly impressed by [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T12:17:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;c4cad5d3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;30a0f167.1502">   <title>Plucked - A History of Hair Removal </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;30a0f167.1502</link>   <description> Dear SAI-IRISH-STUDIES Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Plucked]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/plucked&gt;Plucked&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/plucked&gt;<br><br>A History of Hair Removal<br>Rebecca M. Herzig<br><br>&quot;Clamshell razors, lasers, lye depilatories, tweezers, waxes, threading and electrolysis. Humanity has used an impressive array of tools to remove hair. This is, biologically speaking, pretty strange. Most of Earth's mammals possess luxuriant fur. Only one seeks to remove it. Rebecca Herzig's delightful history of hair removal in America helps explain why: smooth skin is a cultural imperative.&quot;-The Economist, 7th February 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T11:49:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;30a0f167.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff59e106.1502">   <title>Theorizing in Social Science - The Context of Discovery </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff59e106.1502</link>   <description> Dear SAI-IRISH-STUDIES Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Theorizing in Social Science]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/theorizing-in-social-science&gt;Theorizing in Social Science&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/theorizing-in-social-science&gt;<br><br>The Context of Discovery<br>Edited by Richard Swedberg<br>&quot;The debate about methodology in the social sciences has almost completely bypassed discussion of the tools that we can use to build good theories. This book is giant step forward in correcting this omission. If we are lucky, it will stimulate a new branch of methodology devoted to the procedures that analysts can most productively use in the context of discovery.&quot;-James Mahoney, Northwestern University<br>All social scientists learn the celebrated theories [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T12:38:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff59e106.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4d275b46.1502">   <title>Border Politics - Social Movements, Collective Identities, and Globalization </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4d275b46.1502</link>   <description> Dear SAI-IRISH-STUDIES Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Border Politics]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/border-politics&gt;Border Politics&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/border-politics&gt;<br><br>Social Movements, Collective Identities, and Globalization<br>Edited by Nancy A. Naples &amp; Jennifer Bickham Mendez<br>&quot;Border Politics is a groundbreaking book on how borders and boundaries-both territorial and symbolic-shape the mobilization of social movements at the same time that they are instrumental in the very often conflicting identity construction processes of social movements' participants. Nancy A. Naples and Jennifer Bickham Mendez have arranged a significant, comprehensive, and timely collection of essays.&quot;-Pablo Vila, author of Border Identifications and Ethnography at the Border<br>"These chapters [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T12:30:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4d275b46.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;fe08c604.1501">   <title>Writing across Boundaries, 12/13 March, 2015, Penthouse Suite, Collingwood College, Durham University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;fe08c604.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleague (and apologies for cross posting)<br><br>If you are supervising a 3rd (or 4th) year doctoral candidate in the social sciences who is engaged in writing up qualitative data, then you might be interested in applying for them to attend the annual Writing Across Boundaries workshop. This is the sixth year that this very well-received and popular doctoral writing workshop has run, and the fourth time that we are accepting nominations from outside the UK, as well as from British universities. The workshop now runs as an advanced training workshop of the ESRC North East Doctoral Training Centre. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T10:41:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Miller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;fe08c604.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;e897bc51.1501">   <title>Controlling Immigration - A Global Perspective, Third Edition </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;e897bc51.1501</link>   <description> Dear SAI-IRISH-STUDIE subscribers,<br><br>We hope these titles are of interest.<br><br>[Controlling Immigration]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/controlling-immigration-content-content&gt;Controlling Immigration&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/controlling-immigration-content-content&gt;<br><br>A Global Perspective, Third Edition<br>Edited by James Hollifield, Philip Martin &amp; Pia Orrenius<br>&quot;The third edition of Controlling Immigration: A Global Perspective is the best so far. Managing migration is one of the major challenges of the 21st century. Under the able guidance of editors Hollifield, Orrenius, and Martin, the volume provides excellent comparative perspective on immigration policies in both emerging and traditional countries of immigration. A must read for academics and policymakers alike.&quot;-Susan Martin, Donald G. Herzberg Professor of International Migration, Georgetown University<br>"By now [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T11:43:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;e897bc51.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;341d1c9.1501">   <title>Call for inaugural volume for the new book series on New Religious Movements </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;341d1c9.1501</link>   <description> De Gruyter Open, part of De Gruyter publishing group, invites book<br>proposals for the inaugural volume of the new Open Access book series on<br>New Religious Movements.<br><br>The series welcomes written or edited monographs and anthologies on New<br>Religious Movements (NRMs) and alternative spiritualities \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd both empirical<br>and theoretical with interdisciplinary approaches. Of particular interest<br>are those that combine perspectives and methods drawn from all social<br>sciences and humanities on the present, historical and newly emerging NRMs,<br>as well as research methods, issues and problems, and new directions in<br>study of NRMs. More information about the series can be found [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-10T17:43:21+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rasa Pranc</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;341d1c9.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;b90c30e8.1501">   <title>4.5 month RA/ Postdoc post UCD School of Sociology </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;b90c30e8.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>We have just advertised a temporary postdoc/ RA post, working with me on a project on Irish teaching &amp; learning research- see shar.es/1HSpiB for details. Closing<br>date 21st January.<br><br>If you know anyone who might be interested, please forward this email to them.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Sara<br><br>Sara O'Sullivan<br>UCD School of Sociology<br>University College Dublin<br>Dublin 4<br>353-1-7168676=    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-10T16:13:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sara O'Sullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;b90c30e8.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;dfa7ea43.1412">   <title>Fwd: REMINDER you are invited to Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and... (9 Jan 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;dfa7ea43.1412</link>   <description> Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: Sociological Association of Ireland &lt;invite@eventbrite.com&lt;mailto:invite@eventbrite.com&gt;&gt;<br>Date: 14 December 2014 10:33:58 GMT<br>To: &lt;l.connolly@ucc.ie&lt;mailto:l.connolly@ucc.ie&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: REMINDER you are invited to Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and... (9 Jan 2015)<br>Reply-To: &lt;l.connolly@ucc.ie&lt;mailto:l.connolly@ucc.ie&gt;&gt;<br><br>[https://ebmedia.eventbrite.com/s3-s3/marketing/emails/invites/topcorners.gif]<br><br>You are invited to the following event:<br><br>Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and Perspectives &lt;https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/understanding-the-irish-family-new-research-and-perspectives-tickets-14575615057?ref=enivtefor001&amp;invite=NzI4NjUyMy9sLmNvbm5vbGx5QHVjYy5pZS8w&amp;utm_source=eb_email&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=inviteformal001&amp;utm_term=eventpage&gt;<br>[divider]<br><br>Event to be held at the following time, date and location: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-14T10:40:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Connolly, Linda (Sociology)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;dfa7ea43.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4159b1d3.1412">   <title>FW: Winter School in Social Science Research Methods at the University of Limerick </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4159b1d3.1412</link>   <description> Please find attached the UL Winter School in Social Science Research Methods programme. The Winter School takes place between Monday 12 January and Friday 23 January 2015.<br>Training is provided in quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods appropriate to PhD level research. The qualitative and quantitative streams will run alongside one another so students can opt to choose between streams or combine them.<br>Students can also pursue either the quantitative or qualitative module for ECTS credits (each module attracts 10 ECTS credits subject to assessment).<br>For those auditing the course a fee of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd100 applies for those taking it for credit [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T12:26:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Breda.Gray</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;4159b1d3.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;8c211.1411">   <title>Fwd: You're invited to Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and... (9 Jan 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;8c211.1411</link>   <description> Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: Sociological Association of Ireland &lt;invite@eventbrite.com&lt;mailto:invite@eventbrite.com&gt;&gt;<br>Date: 25 November 2014 12:01:02 GMT<br>To: &lt;l.connolly@ucc.ie&lt;mailto:l.connolly@ucc.ie&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: You're invited to Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and... (9 Jan 2015)<br>Reply-To: &lt;l.connolly@ucc.ie&lt;mailto:l.connolly@ucc.ie&gt;&gt;<br><br>[https://ebmedia.eventbrite.com/s3-s3/marketing/emails/invites/topcorners.gif]<br><br>Hello,<br>You are invited to the following event:<br><br>Understanding the 'Irish' Family: New Research and Perspectives &lt;https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/understanding-the-irish-family-new-research-and-perspectives-tickets-14575615057?ref=enivtefor001&amp;invite=NzI3MDY0Ny9sLmNvbm5vbGx5QHVjYy5pZS8w&amp;utm_source=eb_email&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=inviteformal001&amp;utm_term=eventpage&gt;<br>[divider]<br><br>Event to be held at the following time, date and location: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-30T11:46:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Connolly, Linda (Sociology)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;8c211.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;7c50d3f1.1411">   <title>Sacrificing Families: Navigating Laws, Labor, and Love Across Borders </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;7c50d3f1.1411</link>   <description> [cid:image002.jpg@01CFF8F6.2A9C18B0]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/sacrificing-families&gt;Sacrificing Families&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/sacrificing-families&gt;<br><br>Navigating Laws, Labor, and Love Across Borders<br>Leisy Abrego<br>&quot;Leisy Abrego provides an eloquent, empathic view of the agonizing choices made by transnational parents and the consequences for their children. The poignant quotes-from parents and children alike-along Abrego's thoughtful analysis make this an essential read.&quot;-Carola Su\ufffd\ufffdrez-Orozco, University of California, Los Angeles<br>"Leisy Abrego renders in heart-wrenching detail what it means to live as a family separated by thousands of miles. Sacrificing Families is a must read on why families choose to become transnational, how they struggle to overcome distance and time, and the United States immigration policies that [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T12:43:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;7c50d3f1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ed2e720d.1411">   <title>Fwd: Irish Communications Review </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ed2e720d.1411</link>   <description> Volume 14 of *Irish Communications Review* is now available online at<br>www.icr-online.ie<br><br>Submissions now invited for Volume 15. Please disregard.<br>Best wishes,<br>Victoria<br><br>Dr. Victoria Durrer<br>Lecturer in Arts Management and Cultural Policy<br>School of Creative Arts<br>Queen's University Belfast    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-19T19:18:48+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Durrer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;61f627af.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;6433dac3.1405">   <title>Re: Masters courses in Social Research and in Sociology, Queen's University, Belfast </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;6433dac3.1405</link>   <description> Dear Professor Miller,<br>I hope you are well.<br><br>The MA degree programme looks fantastic and rich. Congratulations.<br><br>I'm new at QUB. I'm the Lecturer in Arts Management and Cultural Policy in the School of Creative Arts. I started on March 14th and I'm involved in the MA in ARts Management in Cultural Policy. Shortly after I started I met Dr. Mike Tomlinson and discussed the MA in Social Research as I would like to build greater social research connections for our MA here--my own background is in Art History with a PhD in Sociology. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-19T19:06:44+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Durrer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;6433dac3.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff00e5ea.1405">   <title>Masters courses in Social Research and in Sociology, Queen's University, Belfast </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff00e5ea.1405</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>The School of Sociology, Social Policy &amp; Social Work offer Masters courses in Sociology and in Social Research that can be taken on either a 1-year fulltime or a 2-year part time basis.<br>These courses are an excellent way of obtaining a comprehensive social research background that can be used in applying for research jobs or for progression onto a postgraduate research degree.<br>Details about each course and how to apply are in the attached Word documents. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-19T16:44:23+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Miller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;ff00e5ea.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;90c43a17.1405">   <title>REMINDER AND LIVE ONLINE LINK: Symposium and Reception in honour of Professor Patricia Coughlan </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;90c43a17.1405</link>   <description> Gender, Sexuality and Culture<br>A symposium, followed by a reception, in honour of Professor Patricia Coughlan,<br>to mark the occasion of her retirement from University College Cork<br><br>[cid:196314E6-6405-46EE-BF61-3E52073FE6A4@conference.fu-berlin.de]<br><br>Friday May 16th 2014<br><br>CACSSS Seminar Room,<br><br>Ground Floor, ORB Building<br>UCC<br>&lt;http://www.ucc.ie/&gt; www.ucc.ie&lt;http://www.ucc.ie/&gt;<br><br>This event will be streamed live online and subsequently archived at:<br><br>http://ucc.hosted.panopto.com/Panopto/Pages/Viewer.aspx?id=83febd65-6546-4402-9c16-b3e1ef6e2e04<br><br>All Welcome<br>10.30am Coffee, CACSSS Meeting Room, Ground Floor, ORB Building [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-13T15:15:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Connolly, Linda (Sociology)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;90c43a17.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;f3a2d480.1405">   <title>REMINDER Closing Date (16th May 2014) for Applications: DSA Ireland Postgraduate Research Workshop 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=SAI-IRISH-STUDIES;f3a2d480.1405</link>   <description> Dear list members,<br>The event below may be of interest to you or people you know.
